doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 49 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 12/2/1986]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 49 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 12/2/1986]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. National Gay and Lesbian Task Force reduces its debt in half over the course of six months2. Proliferation of bumper stickers in Chicago reading "Stop AIDS, Castrate Gays"COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine3. London, formation of Lesbians and Gays Support the Print Workers to take on Rupert Murdoch4. Andy Humm on the division of gays during the conference for the March on Washington DCCOMMERCIAL: Stamp Out AIDS featuring Jennifer Bassey5. California, gay father given equal time to respond to 700 Club member's accusations of lewdness and child abuse6. Washington, DC, coverage of politics and clips of openly gay politicians discussing the gay and lesbian political agendaCOMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp7. Seattle, Washington, 3 of 5 TV stations refuse to air AIDS awareness announcement8. Study finds that 3/4ths of the people with CMV strain of AIDS show improvement after treatment with the experimental drug DHPG9. Congress refuses to overturn Washington D.C.'s AIDS insurance law prohibiting providers from testing for AIDS infection prior to insurance approval10. Sports Report, with clips from film, "American Anthem"11. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff BixbyCOMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine2. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, with clips from "LA Law" about an AIDS victim, and interview with culinary writer Sara Friedman, on wild mushroomsCOMMERCIAL: The Monster3. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of "Oh, Coward!" Broadway revue
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 49 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 12/2/1986]: December 1986
